data.name: Snake Draft
data.description:
In fantasy sports, a snake draft is a draft in which the draft order reverses every round. This is an attempt to keep the draft balanced, so that the players who draft first don't have substantially better teams than the others.

For example, if the draft order for the first round is `[Alpha, Bravo, Charlie]`, the draft order for the second round will be `[Charlie, Bravo, Alpha]`. The third round would return to `[Alpha, Bravo, Charlie]`, and so on.

In this Kata, given the first round draft order, you will find the player whose turn is the `nthPick` in the draft (`nthPick` will start at `1`).

## Examples:

    getPlayer(["Alpha", "Bravo", "Charlie"], 1); // -> "Alpha"
    getPlayer(["Alpha", "Bravo", "Charlie"], 3); // -> "Charlie"
    getPlayer(["Alpha", "Bravo", "Charlie"], 4); // -> "Charlie"
    getPlayer(["Alpha", "Bravo", "Charlie"], 6); // -> "Alpha"
    
    getPlayer(["Alpha", "Bravo", "Charlie", "Delta"], 6); // -> "Charlie"
    
    getPlayer(["Alpha", "Bravo", "Charlie", "Delta", "Echo"], 6); // -> "Echo"
